programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves try to stay alive as they host the Nuggets in Game 6 of a West semifinal. MVP Nikola Jokic posted 40 points and 13 assists without a turnover in Denver's 112-97 win in Game 5, handing Minnesota its first three-game skid of 2023-24.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2024 PGA Championship
programme.desc: The field chases Xander Schauffele in the 2024 PGA Championship's second round at Valhalla Golf Club. Schauffele shot his second round of 62 at a major in less than a year, breaking José María Olazábal's course record and taking a three-stroke lead.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pacers try to force a decisive game with the Knicks in Game 6 of this Eastern semifinal. Jalen Brunson roared back to life with 44 points in New York's 121-91 drubbing of Indiana in Game 5. Alec Burks added 18 off the bench for the Knicks.

programme.title: 2024 PGA Championship
programme.desc: The third round of the PGA Championship begins. Valhalla Golf Club, a Jack Nicklaus design, has hosted three previous major championships and the 2008 Ryder Cup. Past major champions at Valhalla include Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Mark Brooks.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mavericks have the Thunder on the ropes entering Game 6 of their West semifinal. Dallas moved within a game of its second Western Conference final in three years with a 104-92 Game 5 victory over Oklahoma City. Luka Doncic (DAL) triple-doubled.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Emanuel Navarrete takes on Denys Berinchyk for the vacant WBO lightweight belt. Navarrete is attempting to join Mexican-born Erik Morales, Jorge Arce, Juan Manuel Marquez, Leo Santa Cruz, and Canelo Alvarez as a four-weight world champion.

programme.title: 2024 PGA Championship
programme.desc: The PGA Championship concludes. With his win at this event in 2023, Brooks Koepka became the 20th golfer with five major championships, and joined Jack Nicklaus and Tiger Woods as the only three-time winners of the PGA during the stroke-play era.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.desc: The Orioles and Mariners resume a three-game set with the middle contest. Seattle starter Luis Castillo won four of his last five turns, and has logged a quality start in six consecutive outings. Anthony Santander (BAL) homered off Castillo in 2023.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Rangers and Angels continue an AL West series. Texas starter José Ureña is 1-1 with a 2.31 ERA in two turns since joining the rotation. Los Angeles lefty Patrick Sandoval looks to bounce back after allowing a career-high 11 hits in a May 12 loss.

programme.title: MLB Postseason Top 10 Moments 2023
programme.desc: We relive the Top 10 most memorable moments from the 2023 MLB postseason.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: North Wilkesboro Speedway hosts the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series at the Wright Brand 250. Last year, in the first trucks race held at the historic North Carolina track since 1996, 2021 Cup Series champion Kyle Larson got a win for Spire Motorsports.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: From North Wilkesboro Speedway in North Wilkesboro, N.C.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series takes a break for the All-Star Open from North Wilkesboro Speedway. Last year, this race was lengthened to 100 laps for the first time since 1991, with current Cup Series rookie Josh Berry winning the opening festivities.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions (6-0) host A.J. McCarron and the Battlehawks (5-1) in a showdown of division leaders. McCarron, who played parts of seven NFL seasons with the Bengals, Raiders and Texans, has passed for 1,306 yards and a UFL-best 13 touchdown tosses.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Nashville SC (3-4-5) ride a 2-1-1 run into a home match against Atlanta United FC (3-6-3). Nashville comes off a 2-0 victory over Toronto. Atlanta is mired in a three-game MLS slide and is 0-4-3 in its last seven after a 1-0 setback at Cincinnati.

programme.desc: Luka Doncic scored 31 points in a triple-double, and the Dallas Mavericks beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 104-92 to take a 3-2 lead in the Western Conference semifinal series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Nikola Jokic scored 40 points and dished out 13 assists and the Denver Nuggets shut down Anthony Edwards in a 112-97 win over the Minnesota Timberwolves that put the reigning NBA champs one win away from the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Wings and Sky meet again. Arike Ogunbowale netted 25 points in the May 15 opener versus Chicago, including 14 in the fourth quarter as Dallas pulled away for an 87-79 victory. Angel Reese (CHI) had 12 points and eight rebounds in her pro debut.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mercury look to regroup as they play their home opener versus the Dream. Phoenix failed to spoil Las Vegas' banner raising on May 14, falling 89-80 to the Aces. Diana Taurasi, who turns 42 in June, led Phoenix with seven 3-pointers and 23 points.

programme.title: Béisbol Esta Noche
programme.desc: Si usted es un fanático del béisbol, entonces no querrá perderse esta noche de recapitulación donde se muestran los momentos más destacados de todos los juegos y actualizaciones de los que siguen en curso. Regularmente presentado por Karl Ravech, quien está acompañado por una combinación de analistas, como los ex jugadores John Kruk y Dave Winfield, el ex manager Terry Francona, y los periodistas Tim Kurkjian y Buster Olney.
